## Overview

- Dataset: World Development Indicators (2022)
- Focus: **distribution** (GDP per capita, life expectancy) and **ranking** (inflation)
- Methods: Python (pandas, matplotlib) rendered with Quarto [@quarto_docs]
- Source attribution: WDI [@worldbank_wdi]

---

## Data Setup
```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df.columns = df.columns.str.lower()
print(f"Rows: {len(df)}, Columns: {len(df.columns)}")
```

## GDP per Capita — Distribution
```{python}
#| fig-cap: "Distribution of GDP per capita across countries (2022)."
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
gdp_vals = df["gdp_per_capita"].dropna()
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(7,4))
ax.hist(gdp_vals, bins=30)
ax.set_title("GDP per Capita (2022): Distribution")
ax.set_xlabel("GDP per Capita (US$)")
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Countries")
plt.tight_layout()
```
Notes: 
Right-skewed distribution with a long upper tail.

## Life Expectancy — Distribution
```{python}
#| fig-cap: "Distribution of life expectancy across countries (2022)."
life_vals = df["life_expectancy"].dropna()
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(7,4))
ax.hist(life_vals, bins=20)
ax.set_title("Life Expectancy (2022): Distribution")
ax.set_xlabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Countries")
plt.tight_layout()
```
Notes: 
Most countries cluster around the low-to-mid 70s.

## Inflation — Ranking (Top 15 by Population)
```{python}
#| fig-cap: "Inflation rate (annual %, 2022) — 15 most populous countries."
pop_col = "total_population"
subset = df[["country","inflation_rate", pop_col]].dropna()
top15 = subset.sort_values(pop_col, ascending=False).head(15)
top15_sorted = top15.sort_values("inflation_rate", ascending=False)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(7,4))
ax.barh(top15_sorted["country"], top15_sorted["inflation_rate"])
ax.invert_yaxis()
ax.set_title("Inflation (2022): Top 15 by Population")
ax.set_xlabel("Inflation rate (annual %)")
ax.set_ylabel("Country")
plt.tight_layout()
```
Notes.
Wide spread across major economies.


## Key Takeaways

- GDP per capita: highly right-skewed distribution (few very high-income countries).

- Life expectancy: tighter spread around ~70–75 years.

- Inflation: substantial variation among the most populous economies.
